name: Fédération Euro-Arménienne pour la Justice et la Démocratie
goal: The European Armenian Federation for Justice & Democracy (EAFJD) is the umbrella organization of the Armenian National Committees in European countries. The EAFJD is the main interlocutor of European citizens of Armenian origin to the EU institutions - working on a better understanding of Armenia and Armenians in the EU and of the EU in Armenia. The European Armenian Federation also advocates for the rights of the Armenian Diaspora in Europe, and the rights of the Armenian minority in Turkey, and in the South Caucasus.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Audiovisual and Media, Budget, Climate Action, Communication, Competition, Consumer Affairs, Culture, Customs, Development, Economic and Financial Affairs, Education, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Enlargement, Enterprise, Environment, External Relations, Financial Stability, Financial Services and Capital Markets Union , Fisheries and Aquaculture, Food Safety, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, General and Institutional Affairs, Home Affairs, Humanitarian Aid, Information Society, Internal Market, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Public Health, Regional Policy, Research and Technology, Sport, Taxation, Trade, Trans-European Networks, Transport, Youth
euInitiatives:
- The EAFJD follows Turkey's accession process to the EU, making sure that the Armenian Genocide recognition is properly included in the negotiations.
- The EAFJD also follows all issues in the South Caucasus - Armenia, Azerbaijan, Georgia - mainly energy, security, defense and lasting peace in the region, specifically in regards to the conflict of Nagorno Karabakh - Artsakh.
- The EAFJD also follows the Euronest Parliamentary Assembly activities, and were present in the last plenary session in Yerevan.
- The EAFJD also works in preserving the Armenian culture, mainly the Western Armenian language, which is spoken in the Diaspora and is in decline, in the last years.
